title: (Security fix) - remove code block that inserts master key hash into DB

body:
## (Security fix) - remove code block that inserts master key hash into DB 

## Details
- We are moving to not store the master key in the DB. This is prone to risks. eg. If your local dev instance had a .env var called `LITELLM_MASTER_KEY=sk-1234", and you connected it to your prod DB - this would insert the master key into your DB. 

This is risk prone, and we are moving away from storing your master key in the DB. It will only be read from your machine .env 

<!-- e.g. "Implement user authentication feature" -->

<!-- e.g. "Fixes #000" -->

If UI changes, send a screenshot/GIF of working UI fixes

<!-- Test procedure -->
- Add a test to ensure that the master key is not inserted into DB on startup
